alert.note: Alert for Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:52PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cowley County through 615 PM CDT... At 552 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Winfield to near Hardy. Movement was east to southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, pea size hail, torrential rainfall, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Burden, Dexter, Cambridge, Maple City and Winfield City Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
